definition[0]: something that you think is true because it is very likely
example[0]: the presumption that their wealth is the result of crime
example[1]: On the presumption that the doctor knows best, I took the medicine.
definition[1]: the act of thinking something is true, bad, or good until it is shown to not be true, bad, or good
example[3]: a strong presumption against development in national parks
definition[2]: behaviour that seems rude and too confident
example[4]: She was enraged by his presumption.
definition[3]: the act of thinking that something is true because it seems very likely, although there is no proof
example[5]: The amendment would create a legal presumption.
example[6]: The claims against the company will be dismissed without any presumption of liability by the defendants.
